intro: Viola multifida, commonly known as the common violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet or purple flowers. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in moist, shady environments. Viola multifida is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
